organic.title: Finding the value of old books - AbeBooks
organic.snippet: One very simple method of finding an approximate value of a book is to search for similar copies on AbeBooks.com and see what prices are being asked.

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do I find out how much my antique book is worth?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: AbeBooks is very useful for finding an approximate value of a book but don't use that value for insurance purposes. If you really need a documented estimate of a book's value (for probate or insurance purposes) then visit your local rare bookshop and pay for a formal appraisal.

peopleAlsoAsk.snippet:
TO DETERMINE THE TRUE MARKET VALUE OF A BOOK, OR ANY OTHER COLLECTIBLE ITEM, AN APPRAISAL MAY BE NECESSARY.
1
What is the condition of the book?
2

Who is the publisher?
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Evaluating Old Books - Enoch Pratt Free Library

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How can I value my old books?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Look for information such as the publication date, printing number and ISBN. This will help you understand where your book stands in the printing history of that title. Signatures or special markings can boost a book's value. For rare or valuable books, think about getting an expert's opinion.
